model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Class keeping an single instance of game. Creates every element needed for a game such as a player, enemies, candies and the labyrinth.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Element> getButtons()
      return the hashmap containing every button in game.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Element> getCandies()
      return the hashmap containing every candy in game.
      Door getDoor()
      return the single instance of the door
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Element> getEnemies()
      return the hashmap containing every enemy in game.
      static Game getInstance()
      Returns the only existing instance of a game.
      Labyrinth getLabyrinth()
      returns the single instance of the labyrinth
      Player getPlayer()
      returns the single instance of a player
      Score getScore()
      return the single instance of the score element.
      void resetGame()
      Resets the game instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Game getInstance()
        Returns the only existing instance of a game.
        Returns:
        the current instance if not null, creates and returns it otherwise.

        returns the single instance of a player
        Returns:

      • getLabyrinth

        public Labyrinth getLabyrinth()
        returns the single instance of the labyrinth
        Returns:
        the current labyrinth

      • getCandies

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Element> getCandies()

        Returns:

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Element> getEnemies()

      • getButtons

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Element> getButtons()

        Returns:

      • getScore

        public Score getScore()
        return the single instance of the score element.
        Returns:

      • getDoor

        public Door getDoor()
        return the single instance of the door
        Returns:
        the current Door element.

      • resetGame

        public void resetGame()
        Resets the game instance. A new Labyrinth is generated. The player is placed at its default position and the door is placed randomly. The various HashMap are also reinitialized and new enemies, candies and buttons are generated.
